page.title: 07CUSTOMS-WEDDING.
page.content: One week before a girl is married her friends dress her up in funny clothes and make up. They take her round the pubs and streets attracting attention by banging pots and spoons. Men kiss the future bride and give her money. She usually carries a chamber pot full of salt which is an old sign of wealth. After the couple have been married they go on honeymoon for a week or two. When they return to their new home the groom carries the bride over the threshold so there is no chance of her tripping as this would be unlucky. At the wedding the couple are given silver horseshoes or black cats as a sign of good luck. After the reception, where everyone has a meal and dances, the couple usually leave in a car which has been decorated.
